definition: to take the lead/to be the first/to set an example
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I hope Your Most Reverend will take the lead and we shall do our best to follow in this work.
sentences.chinese: 希望大主教能帶頭領導，我們將盡心盡力追隨。

sentences.english: In a sense a leader is the pacesetter in doing things.
sentences.chinese: 在某種意義上，領導應是事業的帶頭人。

sentences.english: The construction of socialism new countryside must have the good leaders.
sentences.chinese: 建設社會主義新農村，要有好的帶頭人。

sentences.english: The group also spearheads various social programs in China.
sentences.chinese: 該組織還帶頭參與中國的各種社會活動。

sentences.english: C-sf22 lead single node chain and the addition of data can be deleted.
sentences.chinese: sf22帶頭結點的單鏈表，可以刪除添加數據。

sentences.english: The UK must take a lead in cleaning up emissions, " said Simon Birkett, spokesman for the Campaign for Clean Air in London.
sentences.chinese: 英國必須帶頭清理排放。

sentences.english: Louis Riel, the leader of the Métis was hanged for treason in 1885 for his leading role in resisting the federal government.
sentences.chinese: 瑞爾，因帶頭試圖反抗聯邦政府以叛國的罪名被絞死。

sentences.english: And yes, marketers will lead the way, and probably get a lot of it wrong.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，營銷者將是帶頭者，並且很可能走很多彎路。

sentences.english: The leader apologized and claimed he was confused by the dates.
sentences.chinese: 那位帶頭人表示道歉並聲稱他弄混了日期。

sentences.english: The terms ‘project leader’ and ‘project manager’ are often used interchangeably.
sentences.chinese: 項目帶頭人和項目經理這兩個名詞常常可以互換。

sentences.english: The European Union must assert a common position and take the lead on this.
sentences.chinese: 歐盟必須主張共一個立場，併發揮帶頭作用。

sentences.english: Be a leader when you see a path others have missed.
sentences.chinese: 在別人錯過的路上你要帶頭向前走。

sentences.english: Microsoft needs to muscle into this area and take the lead.
sentences.chinese: 微軟需要進入該領域並且稱爲該領域的帶頭人。

sentences.english: State-owned enterprises, especially the central government - owned enterprises should take the initiative in the implementation thereof.
sentences.chinese: 國有企業特別是中央企業要帶頭落實。

sentences.english: They must also take the lead in working hard and living simply.
sentences.chinese: 艱苦奮鬥，也要高級幹部帶頭。

sentences.english: He led the way in drinking the health of the newlyweds.
sentences.chinese: 他帶頭爲新郎新娘的健康祝酒。

definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
to originate/to initiate/to launch (an attack, an initiative etc)/to start/to propose sth (for the first time)
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
